author: National Bureau
text:
Narendra Modi at a function to mark Dayananda Sarasw-ati’s birth anniversary in New Delhi on Sunday.— PHOTO: PTI

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said the country’s youth must be skilled and the government had taken up several initiatives in that direction.

He was speaking at an event — “Nayi Disha, Naya Sankalp” — organised by the Dayananda Anglo Vedic College Managing Committee to mark the 192nd birth anniversary of Arya Samaj founder, Swami Dayananda Saraswati, at the Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium here.

“Over two crore people have benefited from Mudra Yojana. Besides, financial support has been given to people as we have faith in our citizens,” he said, adding that “Naya Sankalp” should be to raise India’s stature globally and this would be true homage to Swami Dayananda.

Mr. Modi said the DAV College Management Committee had offered to support the Clean Ganga initiative.
title: PM lays stress on skill development
